comment.author: 92033577@N00
comment._content:
The word "castle" to describe this building is a late 20th-century usage, to the best of my knowledge. At the time this image was taken and for most of its life, it was known simply as "The Smithsonian Institution". Until the 1880s when the "other brick building" was completed as the U.S. National Museum (now known as the Arts & Industries Bldg.), that was enough. After the "new" museum, Natural History, opened in 1910, it got more complicated. Then MHT/NMAH in 1964, and so on. Now this is generally known as "The Castle", but, of course, it never was one. I doubt it was called "the castle" in 1900, the likely date of this tinted view.
A better title for this image is "The Smithsonian Institution".
